snippet: Messages posted on the U.S. military accounts, the hackers claimed, listed the names and phone numbers of military personnel, but the documents appeared to be public records.
abstract: United States Central Command's Twitter and YouTube accounts are compromised by hackers who claim to be part of Islamic State group, and messages sympathetic to group are published on accounts; breach is embarrassment for Defense Dept, and some critics question security measures Central Command has in place for their social media accounts.
lead_paragraph: Messages posted on the U.S. military accounts, the hackers claimed, listed the names and phone numbers of military personnel, but the documents appeared to be public records.

headline.main: ISIS Is Cited in Hacking of Central Command’s Twitter and YouTube Accounts
headline.print_headline: U.S. Military Social Media Feeds Are Seized by ISIS Sympathizers

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
